title: v1.6.2+ uses storage.local not sync
details:
As of v1.6.2+, the extension uses browser.storage.local exclusively instead of browser.storage.sync for Quick Tabs state. This change was made to avoid quota issues (storage.sync has 100KB limit vs storage.local 10MB+). 

PanelContentManager.js was updated in this fix to use storage.local for:
- _fetchQuickTabsFromStorage() - fallback when liveStateManager unavailable
- handleCloseMinimized() - reads and writes minimized tab state
- handleCloseAll() - writes empty state to close all tabs

Cross-tab sync works via storage.onChanged event listener which fires when any tab writes to storage.local. The CLEAR_ALL_QUICK_TABS message to background was removed as it was never handled - sync happens through storage.onChanged automatically.
